result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamontay L Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological speciment for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments including DNA surcharge.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts  at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance during term of of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Full time employment or part time employment and school or full time school.

No Contact Order with Police officer Benitez outside of any duties in his official capacity.
No Contact Order with Emmanuel R.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing APRIL 7, 2016, received and filed. (39 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  WISCONSIN STATE PRISON SYSTEM
Associated with Charge #2
submitted by defendant along with the statement read in court

Defendant Lamontay L Williams in court with Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Lamontay L Williams in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Xavier Benitez, Jacqueline W., Lamont J., defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  6  years with  359  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3  years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  3  years.  

Court finds defendant  is  NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with Police Officer Benitez (outside of any duties in his official capacity)
-  No Contact Order with Emmanuel R. 
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Asst. District Atty. B. Wesson in court to inform that he is unable to appear on March 28 due to a scheduling conflict and Atty. Meetz is not opposed to adjournment.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28 on April 7, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.
Deputy clerk will give next court date to Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. bailiff in court.  State is requested to contact Atty. Meetz with next court date.
Clerk:  jms

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Telephone call received from defense counsel requesting adjournment for March 10 sentencing hearing.  No objection by the State. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Case adjourned for sentencing on March 28, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

As to Count 2:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count  1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  1  DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
